description:
Dear AngularJS users,

The AngularJS meetup group has quickly grown to 30 members and it's time to announce our first meeting!


Thanks to Sander Houttekier (member of this group), we can organize the meetup at Digipolis Antwerpen.

We know it won't be easy for everyone to attend but we didn't manage to find a place in Brussels.

Getting there: 

- Feel free to use this Meetup board to share carpool requests or other transport arrangements 
- Digipolis offices are at a 10 minutes walk from Antwerpen south station).
- Digipolis Antwerp has a parkinglot with more than enough space for people comming by car.

The agenda :

- introduction to AngularJS  
- open discussion about AngularJS

The idea of this first meetup is to gather likeminded people and see what we could learn from each other.
Don't hesitate to contact me if you want to participate to some part of the presentation.

Looking forward to meet you, exchange information & learn new tricks.

Kind regards from your organizers
name: Introduction to AngularJS and sharing 'lessons learned' by developers

description: A weekend where developers come together to share and create knowledge and code. Topics are mobile, cloud and web. There will be workshops, talks and open hack.
name: DevFest Belgium - a weekend dedicated to developers

description:
Dear AngularJS users,

First of all, I wish all of you my best wishes for 2014!  

The new year begins and that's the moment we've chosen to announce our third AngularJS Meetup.

This one will be given by Glenn, Thomas and Pieter. 

All of them have been working on a large AngularJS application for almost a year now. 

They have encountered many challenges and found ways to solve these.

They will talk about:

- structuring a large AngularJS application (and building it with grunt)

- writing reusable components

- using AngularJS with a hypermedia API

The event will take place at AE, http://ae.be/contact, which is located at Heverlee (near Leuven).

Looking forward to meet you, exchange information & learn new tricks. 

Kind regards,

GAYL Yassine
name: AngularJS in large applications

description:
Hi AngularJS fans,

We have the pleasure to announce you the next meetup session which will be covering the testing in AngularJS.

This session will be given by Ruben Vermeersch and will be split in two parts: 

Part 1: Unit testing


• Testing the individual components of your application with the Karma Test Runner

• Structuring components for easy testability

• Simulating and stubbing the outside world, ...

Part 2: Integration testing

• Testing the complete application using the new Protractor framework (since Angular 1.2)

• Structuring E2E test suites

• Difficult problems: authentication, backends, ...

The exact content of the presentation is not yet defined, so feel free to contact directly Ruben Vermeersch (member of the meetup), or you can also share your questions on the mailing.

Hope to see you soon!

Cheers,

The Belgian AngularJS Meetup Team
name: Unit and e2e testing in AngularJS

description:
Dear AngularJS users,

The people at Kunstmaan are welcoming us to another Belgian AngularJS meetup. 

The topic this time around will be, "keeping your sanity while developing angular applications on an enterprise level", Daan Poron (@daanporon) and Vincent De Snerck (@SpoBo) will guide us through their experiences

we can expect topics like:

• Structuring a large angularJS app by splitting it up into modules
• The practice of configuration over code to facilitate development of features
• Use and extend the power of UI router
• ...

After that we will have time for showcasing a project, so if there are candidates who want to present a small showcase of a project (20 minutes max). the first showcase will already be a project from Kunstmaan but we have time for 1 or 2 more. Please contact us if you want to show your work.

Looking forward to learn from their experiences and to discuss yours afterwards.


Be quick to reserve your spot!

Kind regards,
Sander Houttekier
how_to_find_us: The location is pretty easily accessible, because it's close to the station and there are two parking lots close by (http://tinyurl.com/minckelersparking & http://tinyurl.com/parking-de-bond)
name: Keep your sanity while developing angular apps on an enterprise scale

description:
By now you’ve probably used AngularJS on one or more websites - without much effort. There are however a lot of extra concerns that come into play when you try to leverage AngularJS for building a full enterprise application.


In this AngularJS Meetup we’ll build an AngularJS enterprise application step by step using a bottom up approach. With our experience building AngularJS enterprise applications we’ll show you how to avoid some common caveats. We’ll show our best practices to: 

• Handle i18n localization for your website.

• Create a Grunt workflow for continuous delivery.

• How to tackle different environments (dev, test, ac) in an efficient and secure way by leveraging middleware.

•  How to leverage generators for common patterns.

From our experience building AngularJS applications for customers, we will show you how to avoid some of the common mistakes. This will be more an interactive session where you can try out the different steps for building the application.

This session is kindly hosted by the people of Dataflow at the business lounge of the OHL soccer team in Leuven (Heverlee).

Speakers

Daan Kets

Daan Kets (Blackbit Consulting, Delta Source) is a flemish independent enterprise IT architect , and currently active as a member of the bpost IT architecture team. He has a strong focus on high-level architectural concerns and business/ICT alignment (using TOGAF & Archimate), as well as new technologies and cloud computing. He started using node.js and AngularJS in 2012, and has become a real enthusiast! In the past Daan was active as a JEE Application Architect, Technical Lead and Developer for several large organisations within the financial and logistics sector in Belgium and abroad.

Mark Noten

Mark Noten (ITFC, Delta Source) has been working for more than 10 years as an independent software engineer offering Java/JEE services for various clients. The last two years he mainly focused on the implementation of a continuous delivery framework at bpost. Currently he performs the role of Java/JEE framework expert to rollout new development standards while focussing more on IT architecture (TOGAF and Archimate certified).
Two years ago he came in contact with the AngularJS client Javascript framework. Since then he implemented an AngularJS enabled dashboard for continuous delivery and other AngularJS applications for different clients.

Delta Source

In 2012, Daan & Mark founded Delta Source Bulgaria together, as a supporting development organisation for their Belgian activities. At Delta Source we develop the software for our Belgian customers, and we use node.js and AngularJS as our core technologies. The last (public) AngularJS application we created is the raadmee.be on-line prediction platform where users can fill in their prediction for the 2014 World Cup soccer.
name: AngularJS take-off
